description: This provides the preferred socket/core/thread counts for the virtual CPU instance exposed to guests. This enables the ability to avoid hitting limitations on vCPU topologies that OS vendors place on their products. See also: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova-specs/tree/specs/juno/virt-driver-vcpu-topology.rst

cpu_sockets.title: vCPU Sockets
cpu_sockets.description: Preferred number of sockets to expose to the guest.

cpu_cores.title: vCPU Cores
cpu_cores.description: Preferred number of cores to expose to the guest.

cpu_threads.title: vCPU Threads
cpu_threads.description: Preferred number of threads to expose to the guest.

cpu_maxsockets.title: Max vCPU Sockets
cpu_maxsockets.description: Maximum number of sockets to expose to the guest.

cpu_maxcores.title: Max vCPU Cores
cpu_maxcores.description: Maximum number of cores to expose to the guest.

cpu_maxthreads.title: Max vCPU Threads
cpu_maxthreads.description: Maximum number of threads to expose to the guest.
